summary: DT: THE CONTACT OWNS A 2000 DODGE INTREPID. AFTER RUNNING THE CAR FOR JUST UNDER 5 YEARS WITH LESS THAN 78,000 MILES THE ENGINE BROKE DOWN WITHOUT WARNING.  AFTER TAKING IT TO THE DEALERSHIP THE SERVICE TECHNICIAN  INDICATED THE ENGINE WAS FILLED WITH  SLUDGE, AND REPAIRS WOULD COST $7000.  THE CAR WAS ADEQUATELY MAINTAINED ACCORDING TO MANUFACTURER'S  RECOMMENDATIONS. CHRYSLER  REFUSED TO HELP WITH THE COST OF THE ENGINE. INDIVIDUALS SPOKEN WITH AT NATIONAL CENTER, AND DEALERSHIP WAS SURPRISED THAT THE CHRYSLER MANUFACTURER WOULD NOT COVER COST OF ENGINE.*AK
